bibl.title: An Early Fragment of the Greek Apophthegmata Patrum
bibl.note: Fragment of a leaf of a parchment codex acquired from B.P. Grenfell in 1896, described and partially transcribed by: F. MADAN and H.H.E. CRASTER, A Summary Catalogue of Western Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library at Oxford. VI (Oxford, 1926) p. 152, No. 32407 (+ p. xxii). Apophthegmata Patrum, Systematic Collections, Book 6, ยง22-24. Provenance unknown, VIIth century. - Codicology. - Palaeography. - Text. - The Textual Tradition of the Apophthegmata Patrum. - The Bodleian Fragment as Part of the Systematic Tradition. - The Cairo Fragment. P. Cair. Inv. SR 3726 [ed.: Claudio GALLAZZI, P. Cair. SR 3726: Frammento degli Apophthegmata Patrum, ZPE 84 (1990) pp. 53-56 et pl. VI a-b]. - The Implications of the Ancient Manuscripts.
bibl.seg: BAGNALL Roger S. and Nikolaos GONIS, An Early Fragment of the Greek Apophthegmata Patrum.
ARG 5 (2003) pp. 260-278 et pll. I-II coul.

Fragment of a leaf of a parchment codex acquired from B.P. Grenfell in 1896, described and partially transcribed by: F. MADAN and H.H.E. CRASTER, A Summary Catalogue of Western Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library at Oxford. VI (Oxford, 1926) p. 152, No. 32407 (+ p. xxii). Apophthegmata Patrum, Systematic Collections, Book 6, ยง22-24. Provenance unknown, VIIth century. - Codicology. - Palaeography. - Text. - The Textual Tradition of the Apophthegmata Patrum. - The Bodleian Fragment as Part of the Systematic Tradition. - The Cairo Fragment. P. Cair. Inv. SR 3726 [ed.: Claudio GALLAZZI, P. Cair. SR 3726: Frammento degli Apophthegmata Patrum, ZPE 84 (1990) pp. 53-56 et pl. VI a-b]. - The Implications of the Ancient Manuscripts.
